posts.name: Can AFARACI
posts.cooked:
Our SparkMax Motor Controller fails to connect PC. We are trying to put our SparkMax Motor Controller in recovery mode but we can not connect it to our PC either with a USB type-C cable nor CAN connections. It has also started to heat considerably fast. We disassembled it once and reassembled the same way. The LED on the SparkMax Motor Controller is dark all the time.  (No CAN connection, No USB type-C connection) What should we do?

Thanks in advence!

link_counts.title: SparkMax Controller failed after a firmware downgrade
SparkMax Controller failed after a firmware downgrade
SparkMax Motor Controller fails to connect PC via USB type-C cable and CAN

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Sounds pretty broken to me.  I’d recommend contacting REV customer support.  Contact info is on their website.

posts.name: Can AFARACI
posts.cooked:
Our SparkMax Motor Controller fails to connect PC. We are trying to put our SparkMax Motor Controller in recovery mode but we can not connect it to our PC either with a USB type-C cable nor CAN connections. It has also started to heat considerably fast. We disassembled it once and reassembled the same way. The LED on the SparkMax Motor Controller is dark all the time. (No CAN connection, No USB type-C connection) What should we do?

Thanks in advence!

posts.name: dyanoshak
posts.cooked:
Please reach out to us at support@revrobotics.com . It sounds like something has been damaged internally if it is generating heat on its own.

Please do not take apart the SPARK MAX unless our support team instructs you to. It is possible to damage the circuitry inside, as static shocks can completely bypass the protection circuitry on a bare circuit board. This kind of damage can mask what, if any, original issue was occurring.

posts.name: Deniz Lapsekili
posts.cooked:
Our SparkMax motor controller failed during a firmware downgrade that we were doing using the REV Hardware Client. The LED for the SparkMax Motor Controller no longer works and when we try to connect to it using a USB type-C cable, our OS fails to recognize it, we tried it with 3 different laptops. We opened it inside, and we were not able to see any recognizable damage.

This is the broken motor controller: 20220125_125506 3024×4032 2.67 MB

20220125_125506 3024×4032 2.67 MB

20220125_125506 3024×4032 2.67 MB

This was due to the hardware or the software and we were exactly following the procedure provided to us in the REV Robotics Docs, if we aren’t able to fix the motor, would you go about telling us how we could get a replacement.

Thank you in advance!

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
Did you try starting it into recovery mode?

https://docs.revrobotics.com/sparkmax/operating-modes/recovery-mode

If that doesn’t fix your issue, emailing support@revrobotics.com will help. They are very good about responding quickly and investigating issues

posts.name: REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO
posts.cooked: Merged all topics from the same team together.

posts.name: Deniz Lapsekili
posts.cooked:
Our SparkMax motor controller failed during a firmware downgrade that we were doing using the REV Hardware Client. The LED for the SparkMax Motor Controller no longer works and when we try to connect to it using a USB type-C cable, our OS fails to recognize it, we tried it with 3 different laptops. We opened it inside, and we were not able to see any recognizable damage.

This is the broken motor controller: 20220125_125506 3024×4032 2.67 MB

20220125_125506 3024×4032 2.67 MB

20220125_125506 3024×4032 2.67 MB

This was due to the hardware or the software and we were exactly following the procedure provided to us in the REV Robotics Docs, if we aren’t able to fix the motor, would you go about telling us how we could get a replacement.

Thank you in advance!

posts.name: dyanoshak
posts.cooked:
The dark LED is consistent with a corrupted firmware update. So I would first try the Recovery Mode procedure that @Ryan_Blue referenced. Here is a working link:

Recovery Mode Instructions

I know it is tempting, but please try not to disassemble the SPARK MAX unless we’ve asked you to through our support channels. It is possible to damage the circuitry inside, as static shocks can completely bypass the protection circuitry on a bare circuit board.

We highly recommend updating the SPARK MAX to the latest firmware, we only tend to recommend a downgrade when trying to troubleshoot or compare between older and newer firmware versions.

If Recovery Mode doesn’t work, please reach out to support@revrobotics.com .
